intro: Fimbristylis tashiroana, commonly known as the Tashiro's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines and Indonesia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
